instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437B: What is 820-3437B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on intermittendly
threads.message:
Hi, 

I've got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board here which sometimes turns on, but mostly doesn't. When it doesn't turn on, the fan spins twice (as usual) and then just stops completely. The owner has cleaned the board with IPA, so no hints on the board. 

Any suggestions before putting it in the ultrasonic cleaner?

Thanks, Rick

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on intermittendly
threads.message: Look closer you can't flush away corrosion with IPA. Crap under something.....<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area first suspect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on intermittendly
threads.message: As there was no corrosion on the board, I decided to replace the clockchip and reflow the parts around it as it had some discoloured test points around it. Fixed the issue. Thanks for helping anyway!
